entry.title: [Auto-disable Accessibility] Fix DCHECK edge case and add testing fieldtrial
entry.content:
This CL continues the feature work of auto-disable accessibility.



With this CL we fix a rare edge case that can appear if a user is

rapidly turning accessibility on/off for a single page. We also add the

fieldtrial testing config in preparation for Finch rollout.

entry.title: [PA] Use alignas on PartitionRoot:Settings type to avoid manual padding
entry.content:
This aligns not only the beginning of PartitionRoot:settings field, but

also its size, so no need for the union trick.



This CL is a no-op, but it'll save us from trouble if Settings ever

grows past kPartitionCachelineSize, which the existing code didn't

handle well.



As a belt-and-suspenders approach, alignas() is added on ::lock_ too.

It's redundant, but it emphasizes the intention, and will save us from

trouble if a stray field gets in between.



Change-Id: Id2220403b8170802b44b05f572e3f4a945ba1ea7

entry.title: Fix auth util crash
entry.content:
With ARCifying, the code that once bridged strings to NSString and

used that API was changed to keep the string as an CFStringRef.

The fact that the string might be null was not accounted for, and

while sending messages to a nil NSString returns zeros, using a null

CFStringRef crashes.



Fix by null-checking.



Fixed: 1457047

entry.title: Rework the parsing of the rounding strategy for round()
entry.content:
Handling/parsing the rounding strategy in ParseValue() means that it

could appear anywhere a value could, although it is only allowed at

position 0 in the round() operation. This could lead to crashes if it

is specified outside of round().



Parse the rounding strategy value explicitly instead to reduce the scope

in which it can appear.



Bug: 1407473

Change-Id: If1bf9b43a3854c89174c3c009f7d833cf8dfa4ac

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4633258

Commit-Queue: Fredrik Söderquist

Reviewed-by: Daniil Sakhapov

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1161194}

entry.title: [ios] Optimise storage of "pinned" status of WebState
entry.content:
The WebStateList used a boolean in each WebStateWrapper to store whether

the WebState is pinned, and at the same time maintain the invariant that

all pinned WebStates are at the beginning of the list.



This means that the same information is duplicated (both in the boolean

and in the position). This could lead to bugs if there is divergence of

the information.



Instead it is possible to only store the number of pinned WebStates and

to check the status for an individual WebState by comparing this index

to the counter.



This optimisation is also used by the new serialisation code to save as

described at go/bling-session-restoration.



Bug: 1383087

Change-Id: I678391c1fae97b40883454121bb638fd389be525

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4628252

entry.title: ArcIntentHelper: Register ArcSettingsAppDelegate as member
entry.content:
This CL removes global unique_ptr and instead let ArcSettingsService

own the ChromeArcSettingsAppDelegate.

We should not use global unique_ptr to avoid global ctor/dtor.



This also resolves dangling ptr Profile since now

ChromeArcSettingsAppDelegate is guaranteed to destructed before

`profile_` becomes invalid.



This CL also removes the duplicate setting of FactoryResetDelegate

inside ArcServiceLauncher.

entry.title: Store is_autofilled attribute in Undo history
entry.content:
It was assumed that we always undo autofilled fields to non-autofilled

fields. This is wrong because we can trigger Autofill from an autofileld

field by focusing on the field in question.



This CL adds the is_autofilled state to the history because it is now

something we can't just assume to be false.

entry.title: [Viz] Change skia_readback_pixeltest.cc's method of populating SI
entry.content:
skia_readback_pixeltest.cc currently populates SharedImages used in

tests via the creation path that takes in pixel data. However, this path

does not work for creating multiplanar SharedImages, which we want to

extend the test to cover. This CL changes the test to instead create

empty SharedImages and populate their planes via Skia.

Reason for revert: Breaks builds, see https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/android-code-coverage-native/14020/overview and https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/reviver/coverage-runner/b8777612281650433537/overview

> jni_generator: Use GN metadata rather than build_config.json for java

>

> restrict JNI registration to parsing only files that actually contain

> JNI.

>

> toolchain.

entry.title: SmartCard: Implement *Transaction in SmartCardProviderAPI
entry.content:
BeginTransaction and EndTransaction.



The mojom methods will be called by the renderer in

third_party/blink/renderer/modules/smart_card/smart_card_connection.h

(done in a separate CL)



content::SmartCardService provides the mojom SmartCardConnection to

the renderer.



Explainer: https://github.com/WICG/web-smart-card/blob/main/README.md

High level design: http://go/web-smart-card-hld



The Web Smart Card API is only available to Isolated Web Apps (in short,

installed js code instead of js code coming from a web server).



Bug: 1386175

Change-Id: Ie5b71a850595198392d783e9ec81d1c72ae8edba

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4615578

entry.title: [@scope] Support limits for implicit scopes
entry.content:
This adds support for specifying scoping limits [1] for @scope rules

with no selector.



In other words, the following is now allowed.



@scope to (.limit) { ... }



[1] https://drafts.csswg.org/css-cascade-6/#scoping-limit



Fixed: 1456331

entry.title: [@scope] Support various at-rules within @scope
entry.content:
This CL adds support for the following rules within @scope:



- @container

- @layer

- @media

- @starting-style

- @supports



Style rules within these rules are now scoped [1] to the enclosing

@scope (if any).



All at-rules are supposed to be allowed within @scope,

including rules which do not contain style rules in their body

(e.g. @property) [2], but this CL only deals with rules that

are valid "nested group rules" [3]. WPT coverage of other at-rules

is tracked by Issue 1450473.



Unlike nesting, @scope does not support declarations directly

within its body. Since we're calling CSSParserImpl::ConsumeLayer

(etc) with a non-nullptr parent_rule_for_nesting also in the @scope

case (since & needs to point to the scoping root), the condition

to enter direct-declaration parsing has been changed to check

nesting_type rather than parent_rule_for_nesting.



Additionally, for @layer, two tweaks were needed:



- Propagate nesting_type: this was just neglected earlier.

- Allow @layer *statements* within @scope: all at-rules

are supposed to be valid within @scope.



[1] https://drafts.csswg.org/css-cascade-6/#scoped-style-rules

[2] https://drafts.csswg.org/css-cascade-6/#scope-scope

[3] https://drafts.csswg.org/css-nesting-1/#nested-group-rules



Fixed: 1451088

Bug: 1450473

Change-Id: Ic4cf9c9f76ca5a008a3054ddd1cf1cb87b6bbf44

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4629290

Reviewed-by: Steinar H Gunderson

Commit-Queue: Anders Hartvoll Ruud

entry.title: SyncPrefs: User migration for kReplaceSyncPromosWithSignInPromos, part 2
entry.content:
This CL implements the part of the migration that depends on the

passphrase state of the user. This is a bit tricky because at the point

in time where the first part of the migration runs (early at browser

startup), the passphrase type isn't known yet.

To handle this, the first part of the migration sets a flag that the

second part should run. The second part gets triggered as soon as the

passphrase state is known.

entry.title: Revert "Clone components when cloning tracks in MediaElementEventListener."
entry.content:
This reverts commit b6f9dd8633cab2218bfeda730ee6c90317fd7072.



Reason for revert: This change led to issues with stopping tracks which appears to be worse than the issue that this change fixed (see crbug.com/1456200)



Original change's description:

> Clone components when cloning tracks in MediaElementEventListener.

>

> Before this change, new MediaStreamTracks created in MediaElementEventListener shared MediaStreamComponents with existing MediaStreamTracks. MediaStreamTracks and MediaStreamComponents are intended to always be used in a one-to-one correspondence and breaking that structure can lead to subtle errors, e.g., during garbage-collection as in https://crbug.com/1308211.

>

> Bug: 1308211

entry.title: Split CascadeExpansion callbacks.
entry.content:
CascadeExpansion handles the case of custom and non-custom properties

separately, then combines them into one callback (taking in

CSSPropertyName), which then promptly splits them up again into

custom and non-custom properties taking different paths.



This doesn't make sense; simply split the two callbacks. Further

down the line, _maybe_ will also help us getting rid of the lookup

into the CSSProperty array, since the callbacks now no longer need

to take in the CSSProperty object.

entry.title: Remove NOTREACHED for infobar in translating step
entry.content:
It seems possible that, if the translate infobar is queued

behind another bar and the status changes before it is

displayed, that the infobar is displayed when its status

is TRANSLATE_STEP_TRANSLATING.

I could not reproduce, but there are multiple reports

showing that this happens.

This CL handles this case properly instead of NOTREACHING.



It does not seem possible to reach this state in TRANSLATE_STEP_NEVER_TRANSLATE, so keep the NOTREACHED in

that case. This can be reevaluated is the NOTREACHED is

still triggers after this CL.



Fixed: 1454237, 1421728

Change-Id: I730103f5decfb134bc5f068968fce880027e30ae

entry.title: Revert "heap: Drop young wrappers for ASWs with pending activity"
entry.content:
This reverts commit e984623d4b619ad66a6e18213d2db86e3fd120e4.



Reason for revert: Possibly causes more crashes with signature:

GlobalHandlesWeakRootsUpdatingVisitor::UpdatePointer(v8::internal::FullObjectSlot)



Original change's description:

> heap: Drop young wrappers for ASWs with pending activity

>

> HasPendingActivity() is currently used an approximation to check

> whether a wrapper for an ActiveScriptWrappable is still alive.

> However, the presence of activity doesn't necessarily mean that the

> wrapper is not gone. Since Blink knows how to recreate wrappers

> anyway, the CL optimistically drops wrappers with pending activity.

>

> The rate of ASWs with pending activity is very minor: 0% on

> Speedometer2 and 2% on cnn:2021. The CL shouldn't lead to an increase

> in recreation rate.

>

> The CL is a prerequisite for the parallel wrapper reclamation feature.

>

> Bug: 1432840

> Change-Id: I246873b40a76f5b706c0227a154582ba22cb9874

entry.title: prerender: Use the primary main frame DevTools agent when prerendering
entry.content:
This CL makes ApplyUserAgentMetadataOverrides and

ApplyNetworkRequestOverrides always use the DevTools agent of the

primary main frame of the WebContents when prerendering.



According to adithyas@'s finding: the client hints override for the

prerender NavigationRequest is done really early (in NavigationRequest's

constructor), and this is called before the

EmulationHandler::SetUserAgentOverride (which is triggered from the

frontend) is called. We can't even take advantage of

waitForDebuggerStart because that implements the delay using a

NavigationThrottle (it defers WillStartRequest), but we haven't even

started WillStartRequest at this point. Using the emulation handler of

the primary main frame becomes more practical solution.



Investigation work log: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1TZmEcVUJM0nQF7Abvdyz-Dnix3EL3S5Bje1XlTLF5FI/edit?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-tWzetFm6jSiwL0K9kr1rXw



Bug: 1434862



Change-Id: Ie71cb942f00e31785f6ddf426a4d967d1e7760fb

entry.title: Revert "Fix control character normalization"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 8872353f738ccae0328f5fc0e50250290007fa6a.



Reason for revert: Investigating usage of control characters



Original change's description:

> Fix control character normalization

>

> `GetCharacter` incorrectly normalizes control sequences (sequences of the form `Ctrl` + Some Printable Character). This CL fixes this issue.

>

> As an aside, this CL also removes `GetText` and `GetUnmodifiedText` since `GetCharacter` now includes the `GetUnmodifiedText` logic and `GetText` behavior is already covered in `GetCharacter`.

>

> Fixed: 1455138

> Change-Id: Ia7787d9f9d649e9f95d5378e79cd4e50124edb98

entry.title: Use Area64() for touch transform controller area calculations.
entry.content:
In the past, there was a touch controller, that when initialised with

the right interleaving with another touch device on the same I2C bus,

reported incorrect, and quite large bounds whose area overflowed the int

returned by gfx::Size::GetArea(). A workaround was added to ignore any

touch devices with an overflowing area.



However, there exist touch devices with a resolution high enough that

this isn't sufficient. Fortunately, since that original workaround,

gfx::Size::Area64() has been added, returning area as a uint64_t, which

does not have the risk of overflowing. Switch to Area64() for both

display and touch device areas and remove the filtering out of

previously-overflowing touch devices.



Bug: b:282082569

Change-Id: Icb279a1f23b81f47b7791f7c4640da386ab10968

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4635060

entry.title: Printing: Avoid points<->pixels roundtrips, untangle magical scaling.
entry.content:
Use CSS pixels where we can, most prominently, in WebPrintParams.

Convert directly from device pixels to CSS pixels. We used to convert

from device pixels to points, then pass this to Blink, and Blink would

convert it to CSS pixels. The fact that this conversion was

taking place wasn't exactly obvious. The values were multiplied by

PrintContext::kPrintingMinimumShrinkFactor, which was documented as a

somewhat mysterious factor, that, according to the documentation, used

to be 1.25, but more recent research had shown that 1.33333 was a better

factor. But there's really nothing magical or heuristic about this.

There are 96 CSS pixels per inch, and there are 72 points per inch.

96/72 = 4/3 ~= 1.33333



Don't expose internal Blink scaling (remove WebLocalFrame::

GetPrintPageShrink()). Blink sometimes scales down content to fit more

content in the inline direction (as an attempt to avoid clipping and

thus losing content). Take care of that internally, which is more

consistent. Blink used to do it internally for web tests

(SpoolPagesWithBoundariesForTesting() in WebLocalFrameImpl), whereas for

printing in actual Chrome, it was done on the outside, by

PrintRenderFrameHelper::PrintPageInternal().



This also improves media query evaluation "for free". We used to perform

some strange conversions in PrepareFrameAndViewForPrint::

ResizeForPrinting(). The input size used to be in points, and then we'd

*divide* the height (but not the width!) by 1.333, and then pretend that

the result was in pixels. Now that "everything" is in pixels, things

will improve automatically, unless we make an effort to prevent it. It's

still not quite right, and this CL isn't about that anyway (added TODO).



Also update the header/footer template. PrintHeaderAndFooter() used to

cancel out scaling, including the internal 1/1.333 (3/4) scaling in

Blink, so that content in headers and footers would appear 1.333 (4/3)

times as large as it should be. This has now been untangled and cleaned

up, so we need to ask for the sizes we actually want to see, rather than

3/4 of that. This includes the options passed to

setupHeaderFooterTemplate(). setupHeaderFooterTemplate() specifies the

page size in pixels, although it was actually passed in points. But that

looked just fine, since everything was accidentally (?) zoomed in by

4/3.



There was some confusion on the web tests side of things.

PrintFrameToBitmap() thinks that it takes a page size in pixels, but

this value was multiplied with 1.333 inside Blink afterwards, so it was

effectively points, not pixels. We need to rebaseline or rewrite quite a

few of the tests before we can remove it, so, for now, keep the magical

1.333 scaling thing for tests. Will follow up with a CL that removes

this and rebaselines / rewrites the tests that need it.



Four tests still need to be rebaselined in this CL, though. The

down-scaling of content inside Blink produces slightly different results

now. Since we're using pixels instead of points, and they are passed as

integer values, we end up with a slightly different aspect ratio, so

that LocalFrame::ResizePageRectsKeepingRatio() doesn't behave exactly

like before. Since this CL fixes some rounding errors, two layout tree

dump tests also need to be rebaselined.



Added a few browser tests, both for crbug.com/1444579 (which was the

main motivation for making this change), and also for crbug.com/1117050

since media query evaluation has improved, because we're now using CSS

pixels.



Two of the new tests are disabled. Since we don't support fractional

page sizes, and round down everything to the nearest integer (e.g.

123.9px -> 123px), content that the author would expect to fit on one

page will fragment. Will deal with this in a follow-up.



Bug: 1444579, 1117050

Change-Id: I076cc9f84591b74925465e364ef2f5f4908bb794

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4567866

Reviewed-by: Lei Zhang

entry.title: Add crash logging to debug a state desync between browser and renderer.
entry.content:
The original race was addressed long ago by `UndoCommitNavigation()`

and, later on, the proper fix using navigation queueing. Unfortunately,

the crash count has recently increased by quite a bit with no obvious

cause.



While this CL does capture the stack trace in quite a few places,

similar crash logging has been previously used without impacting

performance too severely. Hopefully it will be possible to gather enough

crash data so that this can be reverted shortly.

> [blinkpy] Pass/fail the expectations presubmit from linter status code

>

> Searching the human-readable log for matching messages is brittle and

> breaks if logs are added/reworded, as done in crrev.com/c/4623792.

> `lint_test_expectations.py` already has distinct status codes conveying

> the result in a machine-friendly way; use that instead.

> `--verbose` to avoid logging unnoteworthy events.

entry.title: [coverage] Add convenience script to run all fuzzers in parallel while
entry.content:
preserving the resulting profdata files.



Being able to run all fuzzers, in separate processes, is crucial for

efficiently generating a coverage dashboard & tracking individual fuzzer

jobs that fail for whatever reason.



This patch is part of a series, and the overall goal of the series is to

provide a set of convenience scripts to make it simpler to generate

fuzzing coverage reports.

entry.title: [FilesBulkPinning] Enable disabled tests
entry.content:
Previously there was an OR condition to respect the

FeatureManagementDriveFsBulkPinning flag OR the DriveFsBUlkPinning flag

prior to M117. From M117 onwards it would only respect both of them.

This caused the tests to fail when both flags aren't supplied.

CL:4635238 removed this condition, so update the tests to include both

flags and remove the DISABLED_ prefix.



Fixed: 1456621, 1456627, 1456602

entry.title: Intents: Clean up obsolete feature flags
entry.content:
This CL:

- Removes obsolete chrome://flags entries related to the Intent Picker

UI update. We launched the first version of these changes a several

milestones ago, and so the flag is no longer needed.

- Consolidates the "IntentChipSkipsPicker" feature flag into

"LinkCapturingInfoBar". These two features are closely related, and we

no longer need to enable one without the other.



Following this CL, we are left with two base::Features for link

capturing:

1. LinkCapturingUiUpdate, which is enabled on CrOS but remains under

development for Win/Mac/Linux

2. LinkCapturingInfoBar, which remains under development on CrOS



We can add these features back to chrome://flags in the future if

needed.



Bug: 1440362, 1440361, 1440353

entry.title: Revert "[FilesBulkPinning] Ensure metadata changes invalidate all cached rows"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 78295daafd953f5fcce0cf6dfcde8641868f02f8.



Reason for revert: This has caused a regression on performance when

dropping a large number of files into Files app. Seems it

excessively redraws the list view causing it to hang.



Original change's description:

> [FilesBulkPinning] Ensure metadata changes invalidate all cached rows

>

> When metadata is retrieved the cache gets properly invalidated, however,

> only the items that are visible in the viewport get updated by the

> MetadataUpdateController. For items outside the viewport, these are

> cached in the FileListModel and when a user scrolls back the rows

> back into view, they can contain stale information.

>

> Currently many features appear to be invalidating their own individual

> metadata items (e.g. available offline toggle does the pinned icon,

> onDirectoryChanged does the modified time etc.). With the introduction

> of inline sync status this meant the status gets cached and not updated

> if out of view for long enough.

>

> This fix invalidates the indices that have new metadata changes and

> relies on the fact that the MetadataCacheSet only relays information for

> items which actually get changed (instead of blindly updating everything

> item even if nothing changes).

>

> Fixed: b:283204213

> Change-Id: If9e211a12465064b316a42799d1f973ce51e2bf8

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4592153

> Reviewed-by: Luciano Pacheco

> Commit-Queue: Ben Reich

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1154767}



Change-Id: Ia5c9c43e136c4a9a452b821f87ce6e5378d1ff38

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4635437

Bot-Commit: Rubber Stamper

entry.title: Make Ash's ShowSingletonTab use Lacros
entry.content:
... if Lacros is enabled (Ash browser is disabled). This fixes some

shortcuts in Ash (mainly in SWAs such as OS Settings) to use Lacros

rather than open an unwanted Ash browser window:

- Ctrl-J (downloads)

- Ctrl-H (history)

- Ctrl-Shift-O (bookmark manager)

- Ctrl-/ on unbranded Ash builds (help)



It also allows removing previously added special cases for Lacros at

various call-sites.



It also makes ChromeVox's settings button (in the ChromeVox bar) open

the settings in an app window, just like the link in OS Settings already

does.



NOTE: No change in behavior if Lacros is disabled.



Key change:



- On Ash, make ShowSingletonTab and ShowSingletonTabOverwritingNTP open

the URL in a Lacros-compatible way if Lacros is enabled (Ash browser

is disabled).



Enabled by:



- Make ash::TryOpenUrl propagate the disposition to Lacros.



- Make ash::TryOpenUrl take a ChromeSchemeSemantics parameter,

indicating how to interpret chrome:// URLs. This is unfortunately

needed because chrome:// URLs can refer to either Ash or Lacros.



Cleanups:



- Remove existing special casing for Lacros where it became redundant.



Others:



- Disable tests that were expecting the unwanted behavior of Ctrl-/

and are now failing. They need to be rewritten for Lacros, which is

tracked in b:287166176.



Bug: chromium:1444283, b:287166176

AX-Relnotes: n/a.

Change-Id: I6957b08f5950e9ffb296a86781436cfcd1ce7890
